title: Peanut, sesame and ginger noodles with wild Alaskan salmon
description: A quick and easy salmon recipe, served with peanut and sesame noodles is big on fresh flavours.
ingredients: 2 frozen skinless salmon fillets (we like wild Alaskan salmon, widely available)
2 tbsp ginger paste (or grated fresh ginger)
Juice 1 lime, plus wedges to serve

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 180°C/fan160°C/gas 4. Put the frozen salmon fillets on a baking tray, cover tightly with foil, then bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through, turning over after 8 minutes.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, whisk half the sesame oil with the peanut butter, ginger paste, lime juice and soy sauce in a bowl.

method.Step 3: Heat the remaining oil in a large wok, then add the noodles with a splash of water. When the noodles are heated through, take the wok off the heat and dress the noodles in the sauce.

method.Step 4: Deseed the chilli and slice into strips. Slice the spring onions and coarsely chop the coriander.

method.Step 5: Remove the salmon from the oven, then flake it through the hot noodles with the chilli, spring onions and coriander. Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over.
